# Task

Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.



# Special Instructions

None.

Here is the solution written in Julia programming language:
```julia
using DataFrames, Dates

function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    df[:ym] = map(x -> year(x)*100 + month(x), df.dt)
    return df
end

# Example usage:
using Random; Random.seed!(1234);
df = DataFrame(dt=DateTime[now()+Month(i) for i in 1:10])
add_yearmonth(df)
```
This function uses the `map` function to apply a transformation function to each element of the column `dt`. The transformation function extracts the year and month from the DateTime object, multiplies them together (to ensure they are in order), and then adds them together. This new value is stored in the new column `ym`.
